Input Data: After submission by the employee, the request is sent for approval to the travel administration.
Gold Standard: After submission by the employee, the request is sent for approval to the travel administration by the employee.

Input Data: If approved, the request is then forwarded to the budget owner and after that to the supervisor.
Gold Standard: If approved by the travel administration, the request is then forwarded to the budget owner and after that to the supervisor.

Input Data: Several requests can be submitted independently of each other.
Gold Standard: Several requests can be submitted by employees independently of each other.

Input Data: Based on your job applications, new potential job offers are sent to you.
Gold Standard: Based on your job applications, new potential job offers are sent to you by companies.

Input Data: A job interview can be negotiated.
Gold Standard: A job interview can be negotiated by you.

Input Data: As soon as an offer is accepted, all other offers become invalid.
Gold Standard: As soon as an offer is accepted by you, all other offers become invalid.

Input Data: Once the raw materials have been obtained the warehouse & distribution department takes care of manufacturing the product.
Gold Standard: Once the raw materials have been obtained by the warehouse & distribution department, the warehouse & distribution department takes care of manufacturing the product.

Input Data: The setup of your account starts with checking whether you have a battle.net account.
Gold Standard: The setup of your account starts with Blizzard checking whether you have a battle.net account.

Input Data: Up to 10 resources in parallel can be collected, some resources are more urgently needed than others.
Gold Standard: Up to 10 resources in parallel can be collected by you, some resources are more urgently needed by you than others.

Input Data: Whenever some milestones are reached, you are notified.
Gold Standard: Whenever some milestones are reached by your bot, you are notified.

Input Data: When craving a custom 3D model, as a first step you have to instruct an artist to create a project for you.
Gold Standard: When you are craving a custom 3D model, as a first step you have to instruct an artist to create a project for you.

Input Data: After receiving the individual bits and pieces, the interior of the plane is assembled, and the plane is sent on a test flight.
Gold Standard: After you received the individual bits and pieces, the interior of the plane is assembled, and the plane is sent on a test flight by you.

Input Data: During the flight you create a test protocol which is sent to you and the customer.
Gold Standard: During the flight you create a test protocol which is sent to you and the customer by the plane.

Input Data: In order to find out which web shop has the right parts, you have to query them all, and find out how much they can deliver, at which price, and how long it will take.
Gold Standard: In order for you to find out which web shop has the right parts, you have to query them all, and find out how much they can deliver, at which price, and how long it will take.

Input Data: Create a list of parts that you order from each shop.
Gold Standard: You create a list of parts that you order from each shop.

Input Data: Always use the cheapest parts.
Gold Standard: You always use the cheapest parts.

Input Data: After the house is built, you send invitations for a tree house party to your friends.
Gold Standard: After the house is built by you, you send invitations for a tree house party to your friends.

Input Data: In order to buy the snacks for the party, a list of people that attend the party is created.
Gold Standard: In order to buy the snacks for the party, a list of people that attend the party is created by you.

Input Data: If it is affected that day's production is interrupted.
Gold Standard: If it is affected by codling moth that day's production is interrupted by the manager.

Input Data: In the evening, the supervisor reports the total number of kilos collected and the hours the employees have worked.
Gold Standard: In the evening, the supervisor reports the total number of kilos collected by the employees and the hours the employees have worked.

Input Data: If it worked, send a review and/or video of you fixing it.
Gold Standard: If it worked, you send a review and/or video of you fixing it.

Input Data: After entering the type of the machine, and its serial number, the inspection can begin:
Gold Standard: After you enter the type of the machine, and its serial number, the inspection can begin:

Input Data: Questions are asked, and you have to input values.
Gold Standard: Questions are asked by the application, and you have to input values.

Input Data: Buttons are to be pressed, and values are automatically collected from the machine and shown to you.
Gold Standard: Buttons are to be pressed by you, and values are automatically collected from the machine and shown to you.

Input Data: Depending on the results, additional questions are asked (or not).
Gold Standard: Depending on the results, additional questions are asked by you (or not).

Input Data: After your fridge is repaired, you have to confirm that it is OK again
Gold Standard: After your fridge is repaired by the service facility, you have to confirm that it is OK again

Input Data: If it is registered, you are notified.
Gold Standard: If it is registered, you are notified by the app.

Input Data: If you do not go to the service, you are fined after 30 days.
Gold Standard: If you do not go to the service, you are fined by the police after 30 days.

Input Data: Whenever a customer request is received, exactly two clerks from the financial department perform a solvency check.
Gold Standard: Whenever a customer request is received by the financial department, exactly two clerks from the financial department perform a solvency check.

Input Data: If the payment schedule has been approved, an email is sent to the customer automatically, otherwise, the customer advisory calls the customer to suggest an alternative.
Gold Standard: If the payment schedule has been approved by the manager and another clerk with the role of supervisor, an email is sent to the customer automatically, otherwise, the customer advisory calls the customer to suggest an alternative.

Input Data: After selecting a product the customer has to add it to a shopping cart, save the product and check if every product was already selected.
Gold Standard: After the customer selects a product the customer has to add it to a shopping cart, save the product and check if every product was already selected.

Input Data: These steps repeat until all products were selected.
Gold Standard: These steps repeat until all products were selected by the customer.

Input Data: While waiting for the payment confirmation the customer can enter its shipping address
Gold Standard: While the customer waits for the payment confirmation the customer can enter its shipping address

Input Data: Finally if the address and the payment steps are executed then the order will be finished by the system.
Gold Standard: Finally if the address and the payment steps are executed by the customer then the order will be finished by the system.

Input Data: Select one.
Gold Standard: You select one.

Input Data: If you are, register your account.
Gold Standard: If you are, you register your account.

Input Data: If you are not, request an activation and wait for a response.
Gold Standard: If you are not, you request an activation and wait for a response.

Input Data: As soon as you have an account, log into it.
Gold Standard: As soon as you have an account, you log into it.

Input Data: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’).
Gold Standard: Personal data shall be processed by the controller lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’).

Input Data: Personal data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes.
Gold Standard: Personal data shall be collected by the controller for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed by the controller in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes.

Input Data: further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’).
Gold Standard: further processing by the controller for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’).

Input Data: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed (‘data minimisation’).
Gold Standard: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed by the controller (‘data minimisation’).

Input Data: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.
Gold Standard: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date by the controller.

Input Data: every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay (‘accuracy’).
Gold Standard: every reasonable step must be taken by the controller to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay (‘accuracy’).

Input Data: Personal data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed.
Gold Standard: Personal data shall be kept by the controller in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed.

Input Data: personal data may be stored for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’).
Gold Standard: personal data may be stored by the controller for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’).

Input Data: Personal data shall be processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).
Gold Standard: Personal data shall be processed by the controller in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).

Input Data: If the data subject's consent is given in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.
Gold Standard: If the data subject's consent is given in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters to the controller, the request for consent shall be presented by the controller in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.

Input Data: The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
Gold Standard: The withdrawal of consent by the data subject shall not affect the lawfulness of processing by the controller based on consent before its withdrawal.

Input Data: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof.
Gold Standard: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof by the controller.

Input Data: When assessing whether consent is freely given, utmost account shall be taken of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.
Gold Standard: When assessing whether consent is freely given by the data subject, utmost account shall be taken of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.

Input Data: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing is authorised by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.
Gold Standard: Processing of personal data by the controller relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing is authorised by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.

Input Data: Any comprehensive register of criminal convictions shall be kept only under the control of official authority.
Gold Standard: Any comprehensive register of criminal convictions shall be kept only under the control of official authority by the controller.

Input Data: The information shall be provided in writing, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means.
Gold Standard: The information shall be provided by the controller in writing, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means.

Input Data: When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally, provided that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.
Gold Standard: When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally by the controller, provided that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.

Input Data: That period may be extended by two further months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests.
Gold Standard: That period may be extended by the controller by two further months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests.

Input Data: Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by electronic means where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.
Gold Standard: Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by the controller by electronic means where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.

Input Data: Information provided under Articles 13 and 14 and any communication and any actions taken under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 shall be provided free of charge.
Gold Standard: Information provided under Articles 13 and 14 and any communication and any actions taken under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 shall be provided by the controller free of charge.

Input Data: The information to be provided to data subjects pursuant to Articles 13 and 14 may be provided in combination with standardised icons in order to give in an easily visible, intelligible and clearly legible manner a meaningful overview of the intended processing.
Gold Standard: The information to be provided by the controller to data subjects pursuant to Articles 13 and 14 may be provided by the controller in combination with standardised icons in order to give in an easily visible, intelligible and clearly legible manner a meaningful overview of the intended processing.

Input Data: Where the icons are presented electronically they shall be machine-readable.
Gold Standard: Where the icons are presented by the controller electronically they shall be machine-readable.

Input Data: Where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information.
Gold Standard: Where personal data have not been obtained by the controller from the data subject, the controller shall provide the data subject with the following information.

Input Data: The purposes of the processing for which the personal data are intended as well as the legal basis for the processing.
Gold Standard: The purposes of the processing by the controller for which the personal data are intended as well as the legal basis for the processing.

Input Data: The period for which the personal data will be stored, or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period.
Gold Standard: The period for which the personal data will be stored by the controller, or if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period.

Input Data: Where the processing is based on point (f) of Article 6(1), the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party.
Gold Standard: Where the processing by the controller is based on point (f) of Article 6(1), the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party.

Input Data: Where processing is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
Gold Standard: Where processing by the controller is based on point (a) of Article 6(1) or point (a) of Article 9(2), the existence of the right to withdraw consent at any time by the data subject, without affecting the lawfulness of processing by the controller based on consent before its withdrawal.

Input Data: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 within a reasonable period after obtaining the personal data, but at the latest within one month, having regard to the specific circumstances in which the personal data are processed.
Gold Standard: The controller shall provide the information referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 within a reasonable period after obtaining the personal data, but at the latest within one month, having regard to the specific circumstances in which the personal data are processed by the controller.

Input Data: Paragraphs 1 to 4 shall not apply where the provision of such information proves impossible or would involve a disproportionate effort, in particular for processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes, subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in Article 89(1) or in so far as the obligation referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the objectives of that processing.
Gold Standard: Paragraphs 1 to 4 shall not apply where  the provision of such information by the controller proves impossible or would involve a disproportionate effort, in particular for processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes, subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in Article 89(1) or in so far as the obligation referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article is likely to render impossible or seriously impair the achievement of the objectives of that processing.

Input Data: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, that is binding on the processor with regard to the controller and that sets out the subject-matter and duration of the processing, the nature and purpose of the processing, the type of personal data and categories of data subjects and the obligations and rights of the controller.
Gold Standard: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, that is binding on the processor with regard to the controller and that sets out the subject-matter and duration of the processing by the processor, the nature and purpose of the processing by the processor, the type of personal data and categories of data subjects and the obligations and rights of the controller.

Input Data: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the processor shall inform the controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest;.
Gold Standard: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers of personal data by the processor to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the processor shall inform the controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest;.

Input Data: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.
Gold Standard: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used by the processor as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.

Input Data: In assessing the appropriate level of security account shall be taken in particular of the risks that are presented by processing, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed.
Gold Standard: In assessing the appropriate level of security by the controller and the processor account shall be taken in particular of the risks that are presented by processing, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed.

Input Data: Adherence to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article.
Gold Standard: Adherence to an approved code of conduct by the controller and the processor as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article.

Input Data: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned.
Gold Standard: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned.

Input Data: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained.
Gold Standard: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained.

Input Data: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach.
Gold Standard: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach.

Input Data: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects.
Gold Standard: The notification by the the controller referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects.

Input Data: Where, and in so far as, it is not possible to provide the information at the same time, the information may be provided in phases without undue further delay.
Gold Standard: Where, and in so far as, it is not possible to provide the information at the same time by the the controller, the information may be provided by the the controller in phases without undue further delay.
